Using simple math 16:9 image in 1080p has 2.25 times the pixels that of 720p and needs 2.25 times the bitrate for comparable image quality. So that results way bigger file size for 1080p and usually in lesser detail because rippers don't always think about the resolution but file size instead

f.ex. 1.30hr movie in
720p = 4,37GB
1080p = 7,95GB
to match DVD-R and DVD-R DL media respectively
and therefore the bitrate of 1080p is lacking (only x1.81 bigger and not enough)
